comment: Dr. Amy is the best - she genuinely cares about students understanding the material, makes herself very available via Teams, always answers questions in a timely manner, and is more than fair. I've taken 2 classes with Dr. Amy and wish I could take more!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Over the course of the class, you will write a research paper - with sections of it due each week - and a couple of discussion posts. There was a rubric for the submission due each week with VERY clearly laid-out and specific requirements, and the discussion post were also straight-forward. If you follow the weekly rubric, this is an easy class.

For an informatics class, it's mostly research. Select an IS-related topic at the beginning of the semester and write a research paper. Don't forget to do introductions. Pre-recorded lectures. You need to watch and understand her lectures. There is a midterm and a cumulative final which isn't bad if you understand the material. A caring professor.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Class is based on a research paper and two quizzes. You have to work to get an A in this class. She often responded late to emails and could sometimes be a hard grader. Be sure to study the lead true videos for quizzes and start research paper early (1st day of classes if you can). If you like statistics and writing this is the class for you.
Huh

Dr. Amy has been the best professor in the MSIS program. IS7005 was mostly a research and writing class, but the rubrics were clear and the grading fair. The feedback was incredibly helpful and Dr. Amy was very accessible and responsive on email.

Not her fault the class is not Informatics but 100% research and writing class. Entire class is built around a thorough research paper. Her recorded lectures are good, recommend watching at 2x through YouTube. I did not like the class, but had no problem with Dr. Amy. Not what I expected in first class in MIS program.

Dr. Amy is a GEM! She genuinely wants you to succeed. This class though is research based, weekly discussion posts all based on research. one research paper and two exams, ALSO research based. you get a study guide for each exam before hand which you can prepare responses (research based) and simply copy paste. If you LOVE writing, it's an EASY A.

She's easy enough if you follow the instructions for assignments. However, she does grade assignments before they are due so if you want your assignment to count toward your grade, don't wait last minute even though that's what it says on D2L.
Professor was very organize and assignments were aligned to text. Projects were well thought out and given the appropriate time for test and quizzes.

This is the first class I took at KSU using an online format. I've taken online classes through other universities before. This one rates in the top. She had a great format, and was well organized. She responded to all my questions I had via email.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She's very nice and easy going.  Clearly communicates communication and helps you to do your best.  There's a lot of writing and make sure you do the research paper really well.  Very flexible, friendly, intelligent and an awesome Professor!
She i a great teacher and grades fairly.

Dr. Amy was a fantastic professor. She is very organized with her lectures and assignments. Give clear directions for all work. Very friendly and reasonably flexible with the class. Expect to work, but the workload is reasonable. Would take her again. Highly recommended!
Not good.

Dr. Amy is a fantastic professor.  She has a very fair workload for a graduate level class and is probably the best professor in the MSIS program.  Take her for every class that you can possibly get (she currently teaches 3 classes) as she is super nice and very friendly.  The classes are not too difficult, but there is a lot of group work.

had her for 8050 and the intro grad class.  I wouldn't say she's "hot", but as CSIS professors go, she wasn't had to look at.  She was fairly hard, but not more than could be expected from grad-level course work.  I got two A's, and I'm a low B s

Knowledgable & flexible.  Can easily be talked into postponing assignments.  Half group work-pick a good group.  Workload is easy if you don't wait until the last minute.  Great prof - would take again & recommend.
Great teacher and person, tests are hard, and lots of group work but cares about the students and willing to help you if you put forth the effort. Wish she taught my other classes!
Lots of group work, assignments are challenging, excellent speaker, very nice and hot too.
Got the feeling she cared. Was a good teacher. Had tests and group projects.  Group project was rough but making a database is tough.  Would definitley take again.
